statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

article.description: Jared Brownridge hit a long, step-back 3-pointer with 2.7 seconds remaining to give Santa Clara a 64-63 win over Loyola Marymount on Saturday.
article.headline: Brownridge hits step-back 3-pointer to give Santa Clara win
article.linkText: Brownridge hits step-back 3-pointer to give Santa Clara win
article.story: SANTA CLARA, Calif. -- Jared Brownridge hit a long, step-back 3-pointer with 2.7 seconds remaining to give Santa Clara a 64-63 win over Loyola Marymount on Saturday. Brownridge's game-winner was the first field goal for the Broncos since the 6:47 mark when they led 58-53. A 3-pointer by LMU's Brandon Brown with 1 1/2 minutes left gave the Lions their first lead in over 13 minutes and he made 1 of 2 free throws with 23 seconds left to go up 63-61. After Brownridge's 3-pointer, the Lions threw the ball away, their 14th turnover of the second half. Brownridge finished with 25 points, making 5 of 13 3-pointers and 8 of 17 overall for Santa Clara (11-10, 5-3), which led 36-35 at halftime. Matt Hauser added 10 points. Bueay Tauch scored 13 points, Brown 12 and Shamar Johnson 10 for the Lions (9-10, 2-6). LMU won the teams' first meeting this season, 66-56 on Jan. 7.
